intro: Acronychia murina, commonly known as the narrow-leafed acronychia, is a small evergreen tree native to northern Australia. It belongs to the family Malvaceae, which includes hibiscus and cotton plants. The tree has smooth, greyish bark and elliptical leaves that are usually less than 10 centimeters in length. Its flowers are small and yellowish-green, typically appearing in clusters, while the fruit is a capsule that splits open to release seeds. Acronychia murina is often found in coastal areas and is adapted to sandy soils and salty air.
